page.title: 01General Information
page.content: Our 'D' block covers the hamlets of Barton,Kineton,Castlett and Bemborough as well as part of the villages of Temple Guiting and Guiting Power. As we are part of the North Cotswolds we have many hills,rivers and woodlands. The River Windrush rises just to the north of the block and flows into the Thames near Oxford. The land is mainly arable land although there are several flocks of sheep,tree plantations and herds of bullocks. Most buildings are made of local stone with slate roofs and houses have large gardens. Many people take coach tours of the area and the local inns cater for the visiting driver. Most of the young children go to Temple Guiting School whilst those over 11 years go to either Westwood's Grammar School or Bourton Vale Secondary School.
